    public class ShiftLight
extends SIMPluginCallback
    This class implements the interface to the MSPEC Shift Light.

      • DataReady

        public boolean DataReady(SIMPlugin plugin,
                         java.lang.Integer ips)
        Description copied from class: SIMPluginCallback
        This method is called everytime the SIM has new data available. It will be called from the same thread as the main event loop, so be careful with performance. You don't want your plugin to take more than a few milliseconds in the DataReady() method. 
             //This example shows 2 ways to get data from the SIM, using a path or calling the method directly.

     super.DataReady(SIMPlugin,ips);

     Data d;
     d = m_SIMPlugin.getData("/Session/Flags");
     d = m_SIMPlugin.getSession().getFlags();   
     //do something with the data

     return true;
        You can always spawn your own thread(s) and send the data to them through a static variable, like a queue or some other IPC method. If you need to call the SIMPlugin from another thread, do not block the main thread too long. 
             //When calling the SIMPlugin from a thread, you must synchronize on it first. It is not thread safe.
     Data d;
     synchronized (SIMPlugin) {
         //do not spend much time in here, we are blocking the main thread 
         //Get the data and get out of the synchronized block 
         d = m_SIMPlugin.getData("/Session/Flags");
         d = m_SIMPlugin.getSession().getFlags();
     }
     //do something with the data
        Specified by:
        DataReady in interface SIMPlugin.Callback
        Overrides:
        DataReady in class SIMPluginCallback
        Parameters:
        plugin - An instance of the current SIM.
        ips - Iterations per second.
        Returns:
        true to stay alive, false to stop the server.

      • Waiting

        public boolean Waiting(SIMPlugin plugin)
        Description copied from class: SIMPluginCallback
        Waiting() is called every second if the SIM is not providing any data.
        Specified by:
        Waiting in interface SIMPlugin.Callback
        Overrides:
        Waiting in class SIMPluginCallback
        Parameters:
        plugin - An instance of the current SIM.
        Returns:
        true to stay alive, false to stop the server.
